message_1: A block cipher operates on blocks of data of fixed length. Suppose you have a 64-bit block cipher and you want to encrypt a message of 128 bits. How many blocks will you need and what will be the size of the resulting ciphertext in bits?
message_2:
To encrypt a 128-bit message using a 64-bit block cipher, you will need to divide the message into two blocks, each of size 64 bits.

Block 1: 64 bits
Block 2: 64 bits

Since the block cipher operates on 64-bit blocks, the size of the resulting ciphertext for each block will also be 64 bits. Therefore, the total size of the resulting ciphertext for the 128-bit message will be:

Ciphertext Block 1: 64 bits
Ciphertext Block 2: 64 bits

Total size of the resulting ciphertext = 64 bits + 64 bits = 128 bits.
